text: Michel Jean-Pierre Debré (; 15 January 1912 – 2 August 1996) was a French politician. He was the first Prime Minister of the French Fifth Republic. He has been called the "father" of the current Constitution of France. He worked with President Charles de Gaulle from 1959 to 1962. ==References== Category:1912 births Category:1996 deaths Category:Prime ministers of France Category:French Ministers of Finance Category:Politicians from Paris
title: Michel Debré
